element.name: nlev
element.label: number of levels
element.description: Number of depth levels used to describe the water column

element.name: cnpar
element.label: "explicitness" of numerical scheme (between 0.0 and 1.0)
element.description: Constant for the theta scheme used for time integration of diffusion-reaction components. θ=0.5 for Cranck-Nicholson (second-order accurate), θ=0 for Forward Euler (first-order accurate), θ=1 for Backward Euler (first-order accurate). Note that only θ=1 guarantees positive solutions for positive definite systems.

option.label: from equation of state (i.e. from potential temperature and salinity)

element.name: timefmt
element.label: method to specify start and duration of model run

option.label: duration computed from number of time steps, MaxN (bogus start date used)
duration computed from given start and stop dates (number of time steps MaxN computed)
duration computed from number of time steps, MaxN (start date as specified, stop date computed)

element.name: out_fn
element.label: output string used to generate output file names

element.name: mld_method
element.label: how to diagnose mixed layer depth

option.label: mixed layer depth computed from TKE threshold
mixed layer depth from Ri threshold

element.name: diff_k
element.label: TKE threshold for mixed layer depth

element.name: Ri_crit
element.label: Ri threshold for mixed layer depth

element.name: rad_corr
element.label: correct surface buoyancy flux for solar radiation for output

element.name: eq_state_mode
element.label: choice for empirical formula for equation of state

option.label: UNESCO equation of state by Fofonoff and Millard (1983)
equation of state according Jackett et al. (2005)

element.name: eq_state_method
element.label: method to compute density and buoyancy from salinity, potential temperature and pressure

option.label: full equation of state (i.e. with the LOCAL pressure). This implies that T is NOT treated as the potential temperature but rather as the in-situ temperature!
equation of state with pressure evaluated at the surface. This implies that T is treated as the potential temperature and thus rho as the potential density.
linearized equation of state at T0,S0,p0 (again, use p0=p_surf to work with potential temperature and density.)
linear equation of state with T0,S0,dtr0,dsr0

element.name: T0
element.label: reference temperature for linear equation of state

element.name: S0
element.label: reference salinity for linear equation of state

element.name: p0
element.label: reference pressure for linear equation of state

element.name: dtr0
element.label: thermal expansion coefficient for linear equation of state

element.name: dsr0
element.label: saline expansion coefficient for linear equation of state

element.name: z0s_min
element.label: minimum value of z0s, default value if charnock=.false.

element.name: ddu
element.label: grid zooming (surface), 0: no zooming; > 3 strong zooming

element.name: ddl
element.label: grid zooming (bottom), 0: no zooming; > 3 strong zooming

option.label: zooming of grid with ddl, ddu >= 0
sigma grid (relative depth fractions) read from file
cartesian grid (fixed layer height in m) read from file

element.name: grid_file
element.label: file for sigma or cartesian grid. the first line gives the number of layers, the following lines give fractions or layer heights in m from the surface down to the bottom.

element.name: MaxItz0b
element.label: max # of iterations for z0b as function of u_taub

element.name: no_shear
element.label: .true.: shear production term P is set to zero

element.name: calc_fluxes
element.label: surface fluxes calculated by means of bulk formulae

element.name: back_radiation_method
element.label: calculation of long-wave back radiation according to

element.name: hum_method
element.label: decides what is given in 7. column in meteo_file

element.name: rain_impact
element.label: include effect of rain fall on fluxes of sensible heat and momentum

element.name: const_heat
element.label: constant surface heat flux
element.description: Constant value for the surface heat flux, i.e., the sum of the sensible, latent and back-radiation fluxes (but not short wave radiation).

element.name: heatflux_file
element.label: custom heat fluxes
element.description: custom heat fluxes (negative for net outgoing)

option.label: calculated from time, location and cloud cover

element.name: swr_factor
element.label: scale factor for short wave solar radiation
element.description: Scale factor for short wave solar radiation. If set to one, the original values are used. A value different from one might be applied to convert from non-GOTM units, or to test model sensitivity.

option.label: surface momentum fluxes given from file momentumflux_file

element.name: momentumflux_file
element.label: custom momentum fluxes
element.description: file with tx and ty given in N/m^2

option.label: constant value for precipitation (in m/s) used
values for precipitation read from file

element.name: sst_method
element.label: method how sea surface temperature (SST) is given

option.label: no independent SST observation is read from file
independent SST observation is read from file, only for output

element.name: sss_method
element.label: method how sea surface salinity (SSS) is given

option.label: no independent SSS observation is read from file
independent SSS observation is read from file, only for output
analytical eddy visc. and diff. profiles, not coded yet
turbulence Model calculating TKE and length scale

element.name: len_scale_method
element.label: type of model for dissipative length scale

element.name: psi_ubc
element.label: upper boundary condition for the length-scale equation (e.g. epsilon, kl, omega, GLS)

element.name: psi_lbc
element.label: lower boundary condition for the length-scale equation (e.g. epsilon, kl, omega, GLS)

element.name: cw
element.label: constant of the wave-breaking model (Craig & Banner (1994) use cw=100)

element.name: compute_kappa
element.label: compute von Karman constant from model parameters

element.name: compute_c3
element.label: compute c3 (E3 for Mellor-Yamada) for given Ri_st

element.name: length_lim
element.label: apply length scale limitation (see Galperin et al. 1988)

element.name: generic
element.label: the generic model (Umlauf & Burchard, J. Mar. Res., 2003)

element.name: cpsi1
element.label: emp. coef. cpsi1 in psi equation

element.name: cpsi2
element.label: emp. coef. cpsi2 in psi equation

element.name: ce1
element.label: emp. coef. ce1 in diss. eq.

element.name: ce2
element.label: emp. coef. ce2 in diss. eq.

element.name: sig_peps
element.label: if .true. -> the wave breaking parameterisation suggested by Burchard (JPO 31, 2001, 3133-3145) will be used.

element.name: e1
element.label: coef. e1 in MY q**2 l equation

element.name: e2
element.label: coef. e2 in MY q**2 l equation

element.name: e3
element.label: coef. e3 in MY q**2 l equation

element.name: my_length
element.label: prescribed barotropic lengthscale in q**2 l equation of MY

element.name: new_constr
element.label: stabilisation of Mellor-Yamada stability functions according to Burchard & Deleersnijder (2001)

option.label: EASM with weak equilibrium, buoy.-variance algebraic
EASM with weak equilibrium, buoy.-variance from PDE

element.name: kb_method
element.label: type of equation for buoyancy variance

element.name: epsb_method
element.label: type of equation for variance destruction

option.label: read the coefficients from this file
coefficients of Canuto et al. (2001) (version A)
coefficients of Canuto et al. (2001) (version B)

element.name: iw_model
element.label: method to compute internal wave mixing

option.label: Large et al. 1994 internal wave mixing

element.name: alpha
element.label: coeff. for Mellor IWmodel (0: no IW, 0.7 Mellor 1989)

element.name: rich_cr
element.label: critical Richardson number for shear instability

element.name: numiw
element.label: background viscosity for internal wave breaking

element.name: nuhiw
element.label: background diffusivity for internal wave breaking

element.name: kpp_sbl
element.label: .true. for active surface boundary layer module

element.name: kpp_bbl
element.label: .true. for active bottom boundary layer module

element.name: clip_mld
element.label: .true. for clipping of MLD at MO or Ekman scale

element.name: Ric
element.label: critical value of bulk Richardson number

element.name: s_prof_method
element.label: method to create initial or observed salinity profiles

option.label: no initial values, S-equation is not solved
read profiles at different dates from "s_prof_file" and interpolate to GOTM timestep

element.name: s_analyt_method
element.label: method to create analytically precribed inital profile

option.label: set profile to constant value s_1
set profile with constant N^2 (see user's guide)

element.name: s_1
element.label: constant salinity if s_analyt_method=1, upper layer salinity if s_analyt_method=2, surface salinity if s_analyt_method=3

element.name: s_obs_NN
element.label: constant value N^2 corresponding to salinity profile if s_analyt_method=3

element.name: s_prof_file
element.label: filename of file with salinity profiles if s_prof_method=2

element.name: SRelaxTauM
element.label: relaxation time for bulk of the flow

element.name: SRelaxBott
element.label: height of bottom relaxation layer (set to 0. if not used)

element.name: SRelaxSurf
element.label: height of surface relaxation layer (set to 0. if not used)

element.name: tprofile
element.label: observed or prescribed potential temperature profiles

option.label: no initial values, T-equation is not solved
read profiles at different dates from "t_prof_file" and interpolate to GOTM timestep

element.name: t_analyt_method
element.label: method to create analytically precribed inital profile

option.label: set profile to constant value s_1
set profile with constant N^2 (see user's guide)

element.name: t_1
element.label: constant temperature if t_analyt_method=1, upper layer temperature if t_analyt_method=2, surface temperature if t_analyt_method=3

element.name: t_obs_NN
element.label: constant value N^2 corresponding to temperature profile if t_analyt_method=3

element.name: t_prof_file
element.label: filename of file with temperature profiles if t_prof_method=2

element.name: TRelaxTauM
element.label: relaxation time for bulk of the flow

element.name: TRelaxBott
element.label: height of bottom relaxation layer (set to 0. if not used)

element.name: TRelaxSurf
element.label: height of surface relaxation layer (set to 0. if not used)

element.name: ext_press_method
element.label: method to compute external pressure gradient from data

option.label: external pressure gradient from tidal constituents
external pressure gradient from data found in "ext_press_file"

element.name: ext_press_mode
element.label: how to interprete ANY prescribed data for the computation of the external pressure gradient

option.label: interprete all data as surface elevation gradients
interprete all data as current meter measurements at a given height "PressHeight" (see documentation)
interprete all data as vertically averaged current speeds (see documentation)

element.name: PressConstU
element.label: constant pressure gradient data for x-direction

element.name: PressConstV
element.label: constant pressure gradient data for y-direction

element.name: PressHeight
element.label: height above bottom for current meter observations

element.name: int_press_method
element.label: method to compute internal pressure gradient from data

option.label: vertically and temporally constant internal pressure gradient computed from fixed horizontal salinity and temperature gradients
vertically and temporally variable int. pressure gradient computed from data in file "int_press_file"

element.name: extinct_method
element.label: which method used to compute the extinction coefficient

element.name: w_adv_method
element.label: method to specify the vertical advection velocity

option.label: temporally constant vertical advection velocity profile
temporally varying vertical advection velocity profile with "w_adv" and "w_height" both read in from file "w_adv_file"

element.name: w_adv_height0
element.label: constant height of maximum absolute value of vertical advection velocity

filevariable.name: w_height
filevariable.label: height of maximum absolute value of vertical advection velocity

element.name: w_adv_discr
element.label: method to discretize the vertical advection term

element.name: zeta_method
element.label: method to prescribe the sea surface elevation

option.label: sea surface elevation from tidal constituents

element.name: zeta_file
element.label: filename for file with sea surface elevations

element.name: zeta_0
element.label: constant value for sea surface elevation

element.name: wave_nml
element.label: wind waves
element.description: Wind induced waves can be specified. Used in e.g. the spm module to account for wave-current interaction.

element.name: wave_method
element.label: method to prescribe the wind waves

option.label: nothing is done - all variables equal 0
time varying variables read from file

element.name: Tz
element.label: constant value for mean zero-crossing period

element.name: vel_prof_method
element.label: method to create initial or observed velocity profiles

option.label: read profiles at different dates from "vel_prof_file" and interpolate to GOTM timestep

element.name: vel_prof_file
element.label: filename of file with u- and v profiles

element.name: vel_relax_tau
element.label: relaxation time for velocity (set to 1.e15 s for no relaxation)

element.name: vel_relax_ramp
element.label: duration of initial relaxation (set to 1.e15 for constant relaxation)

element.name: e_prof_method
element.label: method to create initial or observed dissipation profiles

option.label: read profiles at different dates from "e_prof_file" and interpolate to GOTM timestep

element.name: e_prof_file
element.label: filename of file with dissipation rate profiles

element.name: bprofile
element.label: prescribed initial profile and initial surface boundary conditions for the dynamic buoyancy equation

element.name: b_obs_surf
element.label: prescribed initial buoyancy at the surface

element.name: b_obs_NN
element.label: prescribed initial value of N^2 (=buoyancy gradient)

element.name: o2_prof_method
element.label: method to select initial observed oxygen profiles

option.label: read profiles at different dates from "o2_prof_file" and interpolate to GOTM timestep

element.name: o2_units
element.label: which unit are the observations reported in

element.name: o2_prof_file
element.label: filename of file with oxygen profiles

element.name: bio_prof_method
element.label: method to create initial or observed biogeochemical profiles

element.name: bio_prof_file
element.label: filename of file with biogeochemical profiles

element.name: ode_method
element.label: ODE scheme for source and sink dynamics

option.label: Modified Patankar 4
option.description: Modified Patankar-RK (does not work, conservat., posit.)

element.name: split_factor
element.label: number of biogeochemical time steps per physical time step

element.name: bioshade_feedback
element.label: feedback of bio-turbidity to temperature equation

element.name: numc
element.label: number of compartments for geobiochemical model

element.name: kc
element.label: attenuation constant for the self shading effect

element.name: rpdu
element.label: p --> d rate (p mortality), in euphotic zone

element.name: rpdl
element.label: p --> d rate (p mortality), below euphotic zone

element.name: aa
element.label: weighting factor for visible light fraction

element.name: bio_iow
element.label: IOW biological model according to Neumann et al. 2002 and Burchard et al. 2005

element.name: numc
element.label: number of compartments for geobiochemical model

element.name: kc
element.label: attenuation constant for the self shading effect

element.name: lds
element.label: rate of detritus sinking into sediment

element.name: aa
element.label: weighting factor for visible light fraction

element.name: numc
element.label: number of compartments for geobiochemical model

element.name: bio_fasham
element.label: Fasham et al. biological model with modifications by Kühn and Radach

element.name: numc
element.label: number of compartments for geobiochemical model

element.name: kc
element.label: attenuation constant for the self shading effect

element.name: aa
element.label: weighting factor for visible light fraction

element.name: numc
element.label: number of compartments for biogeochemical model

element.name: alpha
element.label: initial slope of the PI curve

element.name: aa
element.label: weighting factor for visible light fraction

element.name: fe_ro2m
element.label: maximum oxidation rate of Fe(II)'by O2

element.name: fe_h2o2
element.label: oxidation rate by H2O2 per µmol/m3 H2O2

element.name: fe_lrm
element.label: maximum photoreduction rate of organically complexed Fe

element.name: fe_cuox
element.label: oxidation rate of copper by O2-

element.name: fe_cured
element.label: reduction rate of copper by O2-

element.name: grassfile
element.label: depth-varying maximum excursion limit and friction coefficient

element.name: XP_rat
element.label: efficiency of turbulence production by seagrass friction
